faqs.question: Using FastAPI & Pydantic, how do I define an Optional field with a description
faqs.answer:
To define anOptional field with a description in a FastAPI request body using Pydantic, declare the field in your Pydantic model with a default value of `None` and include a `description` parameter. For example:

```python
from pydantic import BaseModel

class Item(BaseModel):
    name: str
    description: str = None  # Optional field with default None
    description: str = None  # Example with explicit description
    description: str = None, description="A brief description of the item"  # With description
```

This approach uses the default value `None` to indicate the field is optional, and the `description` parameter adds documentation. FastAPI recognizes `None` as a default value to determine optionality, while Pydantic handles validation and serialization. ([Source: body])
